abstract: The notion that the Amazon forest could stop taking up carbon dioxide around 2050, die back, and then start emitting carbon took on new urgency after major droughts in 2005 and 2010.
snippet: The notion that the Amazon forest could stop taking up carbon dioxide around 2050, die back, and then start emitting carbon took on new urgency after major droughts in 2005 and 2010.
lead_paragraph: In an article last weekend about rising stress in the world's forests, I briefly mentioned that computer projections regarding the future of forests are still in a primitive state.
